summary:
• A devastating bushfire ravaged Australia
• The fire was sparked by an out-of-control campfire
• One man claimed he tried to kill others in the blaze

• China is experiencing another year of extreme heat and flooding due to climate change.
• The country's leaders are waking up to the reality of their environmental challenges.
• Climate change has severe consequences, including heatwaves and devastating floods.

• A person recounts their harrowing experience of being kidnapped by armed men in Ethiopia
• The individual managed to escape from their captors after a terrifying ordeal
• Details of the incident remain unclear but highlight the dangers faced by individuals in Ethiopia

• Carla Bruni-Sarkozy faces charges of witness tampering.
• An Ariane-6 rocket successfully launched into space during its inaugural flight.
• The upcoming Paris Olympics may set a new standard for accommodating competing mothers.

• NBA star becomes first black Greek Olympic flagbearer
• Historic milestone in representation and diversity
• Breaks barriers in promoting inclusivity and equality

• A lavish Indian wedding has gone viral globally.
• It features an elaborate ceremony with traditional attire and customs.
• The event showcases India's rich cultural heritage to international audiences.

• Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's widow was sentenced to death in Iraq
• No further details provided

• Pilots' union to suspend Aer Lingus industrial action
• Industrial action suspended 
• No further information available

• Israel demands evacuation from Gaza City.
• Hundreds of thousands affected by the call for evacuation.
• Gaza City's healthcare system collapses under renewed Israeli aggression.

• Japan seeks to ease bear-hunting restrictions amid rising incidents
• Authorities consider loosening regulations due to increased human-bear conflicts
• Decision aims to reduce threat from bears while ensuring public safety

• Fears of a potential war between Israel and Lebanon have intensified.
• The escalation in tensions is driven by concerns over Hezbollah's military capabilities.
• This has raised alarm bells among regional powers, who fear a conflict could destabilize the entire region.

• A South Korean politician has sparked outrage by blaming women for the rising number of male suicides.
• The politician's comments have been widely criticized as insensitive and offensive.
• Many people in South Korea are calling for greater awareness about mental health issues to reduce suicide rates.

• Protesters in Barcelona use water guns to deter tourists
• Locals unhappy with influx of visitors
• Tourists targeted by residents

• A photographer undertook an 11-day trek to escape war-torn Sudan.
• The photographer faced numerous challenges during their journey.
• The trek was a dangerous undertaking due to the ongoing conflict in Sudan.

• George Clooney urges Joe Biden to quit as the Democratic presidential candidate.
• Alec Baldwin pretended to hold a real weapon during a rehearsal for the film "Rust."
• British politician Keir Starmer met US President Joe Biden to strengthen their special bond.
• A teenager stopped a runaway boat by jumping off a jet ski.
• The NATO summit may affect Joe Biden's chances of being elected.

• British politician Keir Starmer met US President Joe Biden to strengthen their special bond.
• US officials plan to supply 500-pound bombs to Israel despite previously suspending this practice.
• The United States is providing additional air defense systems to protect against further missile strikes on civilian targets such as hospitals in Ukraine.

• NATO vows "irreversible path" to Ukraine membership.
• Ukraine's first F-16 fighter jets may engage in combat missions this summer.
• NATO promises long-term support for Ukraine, but doesn't guarantee membership.
